reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel, along with 10 others, during April 2012 as part of a 17 day road trip across GA, NC, SC. By giving the star rating I am not saying the hotel is a 5 star but whether it was clean and value for the money and to an extent we have compared then to the other 10 hotels we stayed at.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Unlike some others this Comfort suites was more like a proper hotel were you park as near the reception as possible and take your luggage through the reception to a lift to your room. This felt much safer to us than the motel types were your room door is accessible to all from the street.
reviews.title: Clean, but smells "old"

reviews.text: On arrival we were allocated, as requested, a one king size bedded room. Having this instead of 2 queen sized beds gave a lot more space in the bedroom.
reviews.title: Great stay, but no elevator to second floor

reviews.text: The room was excellent. It was big, clean, clean towels, lots of hot water and well maintained. The bathroom was equally impressive. The only drawback to all these types of hotel is a shower curtain instead of a proper screen (small niggle)
reviews.title: Quiet and clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The included breakfast was also very good with lots on offer including the very rare real OJ, and a hot choice as well as all the bakery products.
reviews.title: First Time In The Milledgeville Area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed a few nights over Thanksgiving. Expected it to be a mad house. It wasn't, or at least if it was, we had no idea. Rooms were nice and comfortable, had plenty of space very clean and quiet, which is a huge deal for me in a hotel. I need peace and quiet! Pool area was fabulous and breakfast was great! My next visit to Milledgeville (even though there is nothing in that town but wal-mart) I will definately stay here again!
reviews.title: Great

reviews.text: We moved over to the Comfort Suites due to lack of service at the Fairfield Inn next door. While staying at the other hotel I was invited over here to check the temperature of Comfort Suites indoor pool which I assure you is what a heated pool should feel like, which is a shame on Marriott's part. Comfort Suites is not as trendy as the Fairfield Inn, but is elegant looking when you walk in. They gave us an even better rate than their standard and military rate since my husband is here working in the area (and I am told that they have a "your rates are too high rate.") In my opinion their regular rate is a value to begin with. The staff was very friendly and seem to enjoy working here...they're not just hanging out here, they actually work, lol. They also made it a point to let us know that they were booking a room that was empty the night before for us so that we could check in immediately after checking out of the Fairfield, instead of having to wait until the usual check in time.
reviews.title: Family Friendly

reviews.text: Once in the room you can tell the hotel's age, the bathrooms are tiny and the bathtub/shower is not as nice as I would expect in an average hotel, but everything is clean which is the most important part. The suites are larger which works well with our family of five.
reviews.title: Very nice --can't go wrong--NO elevator!

reviews.text: Their baby cribs are actually little metal cribs on wheels, which I'm not really comfortable with, (I prefer the usual pack n' play portable crib) but we haven't had any problems other than bedding with it yet. They gave us two regular bed sheets for the tiny mattress in the crib. We had to use a regular sized blanket as well, which I worry that my two year old may get himself wrapped up in.
reviews.title: Great value, nice staff, and comfortable bed

reviews.text: There was not a whole lot of options as far as a hot breakfast goes here. All they provided was eggs & canadian bacon. Your options to make a breakfast sandwich with it were bagels or sandwich bread (toast.) I would prefer a biscut or an english muffin, but we made do. So of course there were muffins, cereal, pastries, the waffle iron and fruit as well..."the basics." The kids were ecstatic about the pastries as that was not an option next door, but, I am hoping for something different tomorrow as far as the hot breakfast goes, if not I'll settle for a fresh waffle I guess. :- )
reviews.title: Very nice stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here often off and on for about 2 years as we drove through Milledgeville. The accomodations are nice. Very clean. Staff was very accomodating. Will stay here again. No complaints!
reviews.title: nice comfortable clean hotel

reviews.text: This is the third year in a row that we have stayed at this hotel. The rooms are big, very clean and the beds are comfortable. The best thing about this hotel is the indoor pool. We were so pleased to find that the water was warm. The staff is extremely professional and we were allowed an early check in which was great. The only thing that could be improved is the quality of the continental breakfast. But in no way would this prevent us from staying here again. We will DEFINITELY be back!
reviews.title: Awesome hotel for a great price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the comfort suites while in town for a wedding. The rooms are very spacious and very clean. Some of our group was staying elsewhere but when they saw our room they switched hotels. The pool was a little cold and there was no elevator but with only two floors stairs aren't bad. We will definitely be back next time we are in town.
reviews.title: Very Nice and Clean Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here 1 night while doing the Antebellum Trail, and paid less than $80 for a room with a king-size bed. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Room was clean and comfortable. I'd be happy to recommend this hotel to friends and family traveling in GA.
reviews.title: Great value, great stay

reviews.text: Wow! We were here for a Youth Event at Rock Eagle and we had several rooms. Everyone was impressed. The rooms were so clean and spacious. The pool and pool area was clean too. The staff was very friendly. Trey and his mom (sorry, I didn't get her name) were very nice at the front desk. One cleaning lady was in the hall and was also very friendly, she asked if we needed anything. A good clean hotel is hard to find, especially with a friendly staff too. Thanks for a great stay!
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: The motel is only a couple of years old. The suites are spacious. The rooms are clean. The beds are comfortable, but the pillows aren't the greatest. Microwave and refrigerator in each room. It's nice to sit on the couch and read at night. Almost like home.
reviews.title: Nice Newer Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great stop if you are coming to or from out of town for a UGA game. Great valuehotel. Rooms are clean and nicer than expected for the price. Decent breakfast included with your stay. Convenient location and near restaurants. Have stayed here multiple times and plan to continue.
reviews.title: We are regulars

reviews.text: Visited Milledgeville for one night and stayed at Comfort Suites based on Tripadvisor reviews and price. Very nice room and overall very clean, but I noticed when I took a shower that the bathroom floor felt sticky and then looking at the marks on the outside of the tub I deduced the floor had been cleaned with a dirty mop and water. The beds and pillows were super comfortable. I had asked for a quiet room away from noise and upstairs and was given #212 which is upstairs but near the main stairway so could hear people in the hallway and downstairs in the open lobby, but it was quiet after 10 pm. The dining area for breakfast was clean and bright and had the usual assortment of continental breakfast items. All the employees I had contact with were very nice.
reviews.title: Would definitely stay again

reviews.text: My husband is staying in this hotel. I called the front desk and ask the front desk clerk to transfer me to his room. She told me NO and then connected me to someone else's room. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. I don't believe this motel is under new management. Because if it were, then the customer service would be better.
reviews.title: Awful Customer Service

reviews.text: Hotel is convenient to Milledgeville and located near most of the other hotels in the area. Pool area is nice, rooms are spacious. Free breakfast was mediocre. Room and facilities seemed clean.
reviews.title: Good experience
